meanings.definition: A person who observes or watches something.
meanings.sent1: The interobserver carefully watched the birds in the park.
meanings.sent2: The interobserver noted every detail of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The interobserver couldn't help but peek through the keyhole.
meanings.sent4: She was like an interobserver in the bustling city, taking in every movement.
meanings.sent5: The diligent interobserver never missed a thing during the surveillance.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the observation of others.
meanings.sent1: The interobserver study focused on behavior in social settings.
meanings.sent2: Her interobserver skills helped her understand human interactions better.
meanings.sent3: The interobserver perspective provided a unique insight into the situation.
meanings.sent4: His interobserver role in the team made him the go-to person for analysis.
meanings.sent5: The interobserver approach shed light on hidden patterns of behavior.
